name: Steve

Stayed about a week
review_text:
Our stay at Gram's Waterfront Cottage was wonderful! The cottage exuded a cozy charm that made us feel right at home from the moment we arrived. The serene waterfront location provided a peaceful retreat, and the views were simply breathtaking.
The attention to detail in the cottage's decor and amenities was evident, and we appreciated the thoughtful touches throughout the space. Whether we were enjoying a quiet evening by the waterfront or sipping coffee on the deck while watching the wildlife, every moment felt special.
Einar & Dawn were wonderful hosts, offering a warm welcome and helpful tips for exploring the area. Their hospitality made our stay even more enjoyable.
Overall, I highly recommend Gram's Waterfront Cottage for anyone looking for a relaxing getaway. Thank you,Einar & Dawn, for a much needed ralxing stay!

review_text: I always recommend self care to my clients. Part of that self care is spending time with yourself to shed the scales of stress and to recenter. Yoga and meditation are great but just to be with oneself and get away from the â€œobligationsâ€ of modern life: work, family, friends, home stuff. This is a beautiful scenic, private location perfect for this. It has a sizable back yard with luscious grass to walk barefoot on, in addition to being right in the water. I counted at least six seals swimming across the bay. They return to their home around two hrs prior to sunset. The place is clean, small but cozy, and has all the necessary amenities. The hosts are gracious and friendly with their communications. I am definitely bookmarking this gem. Itâ€™s perfect for any busy Seattleite that needs space from the city. A quick trip on the ferry and boom ya there. Itâ€™s also walking distance to the eateries and bars. I loved it.

review_text: Gram's Cottage is a real treasure; this was my second stay recently. The location is unparalleled, especially on a beautiful sunny weekend. This time I spent time on the covered porch watching numerous sea mammals surfacing as they swam by right in front of the cottage. Also, quaint boats of all kinds were fun to watch. Beach access in front of the cottage is easy with an excellent set of sturdy stairs. Quiet, charming & restful. Nearby Saboteur Bakery is a must; they sell-out early.

name: Alison
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
November 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: What a darling cottage, we had such a wonderful stay here! Check in was a breeze, the cottage was immaculate and beautifully furnished. The bed was very comfortable, the linens and towels are of excellent quality. The kitchen was well stocked with everything you would need and even some extras. We really enjoyed sitting on the porch watching the ferry go by, and saw sea lions, otters, tons of cormorants, plus a Belted Kingfisher and the two amusing resident hummingbirds. The location is perfect: you're right on the water in a quiet neighborhood, but you're also in walking distance of several great restaurants: La Fermata, Hound & Bottle, The Boat Shed. Even if you're not a morning person, getting up in time to hit Saboteur Bakery when they open is worth it for their exceptional pastries. If you want to go slightly farther afield, the Puget Sound Navy Museum, the USS Turner-Joy, and the Kitsap History Museum are just across the Manette Bridge and worth the trip. Vintage shoppers will love the Manette Trading Company, Manette Antiques, and Ish Vintage. We don't usually repeat our Airbnb stays, but we'll definitely book Gram's Waterfront Cottage again!

The house is cute and well-furnished (bed is comfortable which is always important). Everything seemed clean and the water pressure in the shower was great. Despite the proximity of the houses on either side, there was not much noise and we had a very quiet time overall (the backyard feels very private). Hosts were very responsive to questions and even let us know about a submarine going by shortly after we arrived. The cat Minnie also came and visited with us a couple times which was fun. Overall, highly recommend!

The home is conveniently situated about 10 min from the ferry terminal and within a few minutes from a small grocery store, and some bars/restaurants. I would recommend checking out Saboteur which is a tiny bakery with a small selection of french pastries. The internet also worked great for streaming Netflix, so I assume it should suffice should you want to work remotely from here. We hope to stay here again in the future and hopefully bring our boat next time to do some fishing and crabbing around the area.

I canâ€™t say enough about how wonderful this cottage is! My husband and I stayed here for two weeks, and it was the perfect vacation. The cottage is sparkling clean, situated right on Sinclair Inlet where you can watch the ferries go by and hear the waves splashing against the bulkhead, itâ€™s within walking distance of several great restaurants, and its just a short drive to catch the ferry to Seattle.
Itâ€™s got a fully stocked kitchen (including condiments in the refrigerator and spices and some staples in the pantry). There is a full size washer and dryer in the laundry room and a fireplace in the living room.
Dawn has decorated the house with a beachy theme, and itâ€™s so cute and cosy. The bed and the furniture are very comfortable, and there are extra pillows and blankets if you need them. The bathroom linen closet is stocked with big fluffy white bath towels worthy of a five star hotel.
Weâ€™ve stayed in several AIRbnbs in the past, and this one is by far the best. Weâ€™ll definitely be coming back!

I was able to have fun with my two grandsons on the pickle ball court located on the property. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a quiet place to rest.

Stayed over a week
review_text:
We could not have asked for a more perfect home away from home than this charming house, nor more gracious and conscientious hosts. We were here for almost a month, and enjoyed every minute of this comfortable home. The kitchen has all you need, the beds are comfy, parking is convenient, and the house was immaculately clean. We loved all the windows, especially the sunny breakfast nook and the glassed in porch with large screened windows, the shiny hardwood floors, and the vintage touches!
The location was very nice, with a neighborhood feel, and convenient to our daughter, son in law and grandson who we had come to visit. Jacque and Stuart welcome their guests to make use of their waterfront, which is quite lovely, and their beach toys. Unfortunately we did not have the time this trip or the weather to really take advantage of this, but hopefully we can do so on a return visit. You can see a slice of the water from the Airbnb, and it makes for a very pretty view.
Our hosts were so considerate, welcoming us with homemade cookies and a pack n play for when our baby grandson was at â€˜ourâ€™ house. Jacque even shared some of her freshly made granola with us, and it was delicious and appreciated. So, bottom line, absolutely stay here if you have the opportunity - we are certainly happy that we did!

review_text:
The Little Guest House on Oyster Bay is amazing! It is located in a beautiful, wooded area with a view of the bay, giving the feel of being far away in a secluded area, yet you are only a few minutes drive to all the conveniences of the outside world (grocery shopping, fast food, gas, etc.) Jacque and Stu have done an incredible job in creating a beautiful, charming, inviting, fun home. Itâ€™s like stepping back in time but with all the modern-day comforts. The kitchen has plenty of dishes, cookware, utensils, storage containers and even sandwhich baggies, foil and plastic wrap! There were books and games for kids and adults. They thought of everything! They even had a tide chart printed out for the week we were thereâ€¦low tide was a great time to go down to the water to skip rocks and find lots of shells.
Jacque and Stu are super friendly and were always available to answer questions and assist in any way needed. They went out of their way to make sure our stay was the best it could be. It was the perfect place for our family, and we would go back there in a heartbeat! Keeping our fingers crossed that it will be available the next time we are in Washington.

Stayed about a week
review_text: This is really one of the most charming and comfortable apartments we have ever stayed in. I wish everyone could wake up and enjoy their coffee while savoring the view of the Olympic Mountains that can be seen through Eric's extraordinary picture windows. And if the weather gods have given you a cloudy day, you'll still find yourself on a beautiful, timbered hillside. The apartment itself has a clean, modern look that my wife and I find very inviting. On the practical side, you will have a well-stocked kitchen, a very comfortable queen size bed, a dish washer, a laundry room and a good wifi signal. Although the location feels pleasantly remote, in reality you will be just minutes away from good restaurants and shopping. To top everything off, Eric and Vicky are wonderful hosts. They made sure we knew how to find and access the apartment, and when we arrived we found it well stocked with arrival goodies and nicely decorated for the holidays. We hope they always keep the light on for us.

Itâ€™s only a few minutes from a ferry to Seattle if you want to explore the sound, and is also in a private and quaint area to go on beautiful walks along the water if you feel inclined. The property is definitely isolated, but in the best way! Quite literally had the best view of Mt. Olympus on a clear day, and the actual loft was spacious, modern, clean, and homey all in one. The host was super welcoming and took time to greet us, as well us giving us gracious space to enjoy our stay and offered immediate communication if necessary. We will find ourselves here once again if we plan a trip in the PNW! This is the perfect destination for you!

review_text:
I have stayed at AirBnBs for 10+ years and have met several hosts. Vicky and Eric have raised the bar for me. The place itself is absolutely stunning, serene, modern, charming, stylish design, every item - from soap dish, to pillows, to bedsheets, to towels to Keurig coffee pod flavors, to getting greeted by your hosts and freshly baked cookies upon arrival, to vastness of high ceilings nestled around Olympics, lush greenery... makes this a gem in PNW! And definitely in Bremerton.
I woke up each morning to birdsong, surrounded by nature, and thoroughly enjoyed salted caramel mocha coffee and cookies, and snacks they provided. I explored nearly trails, parks (Lion's park is down the street), restaurants close by and looked forward to coming back to this sanctuary to read or just stare at the mountains. There are 2 Smart TVs, board games, comfy couch and fully stocked kitchen if you like to cook. You are less than 10 minutes to the Ferry terminal to Seattle.
Having said all this, what made my experience exceptional are the hosts. They are some of the most kind, thoughtful, generous, classy, down to earth people you will ever meet. I cannot wait to go back! And if you are reading this, and if you are lucky to find availability, book it!

Loved this private, cozy cottage with a view. Romantic space for two! Fireplace, enclosed porch overlooking the water, and deck with table and chairs. Nice touches everywhereâ€¦lighting, Keurig and electric water heating pot, very nice touches. Calming, fresh decor.
Sat on the porch in the am with coffee and watched the fog roll by. We had pizza and wine on the deck the last night. The bed was comfortable. Temperature control is by room so very flexible. Kitchen had everything you need and laundry equipment is nice. Appreciated having the essentials like paper products, soapâ€¦vs buying just to start your stay.
Shoreline access for walks and nearby ferry to Seattle were a plus. Note: plan around ferry schedule each way. Whale watching out of Port Townsend followed 5 Orcas and sighted a grey whale (hump and tail). Recommend the Toad House (5 minutes away) for pizza. Going to Seattle for dinner? Look up the Pink Door, eclectic upscale environment and excellent Italian food.

review_text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Tom and Jeanâ€™s. The studio was plenty of space for two, especially given our days were mostly spent outside. Access to the beach at low tide, and a bench swing under grape vines were two of our favorites. Parking was snug, but doable. Noise is very minimal considering how close to the (excellent) busy restaurant nearby. We had lots of sea birds to watch, including bald eagles and cormorants, a seal snoozing on the dock next door, and Tom told us about the river otters that visited while we were there, though we missed them.
The location was perfect for us. We spent our time mostly walking. Crossing Manette Bridge we explored the waterfront Fountain Park, the Naval Museum, and ran out of time for the Turner Joy tour. Lots of good eateries, and met some great folks at The Shack on the marina dock. Another day we drove to nearby Lions Park and wished weâ€™d had pickle ball equipment, but had fun walking the beach and exploring the park.

I stayed for a week and used this as my office during the week, and relaxation on the weekend. The studio has everything you need, and allowed me to make some home-cooked meals as well as experience some of the cute local restaurants.
I highly recommend this location for a fun solo trip -or- a couples get-away. The view from the mini patio is awesome and the bed is very comfortable!
Thank you, Tom & Jean!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

May 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This is exactly what we were looking for when we wanted to visit Seattle but not stay in the city. The ferry is a short walk from Tom and Jean's wonderful place, and the ferry itself gave us time to plan our day or unwind from our time in Seattle, and the views on the water were amazing. The place itself is perfectly appointed and has everything you need for your stay. The bed was super comfy, the kitchen was set up like home, and the beach right outside the door was a wonder for a landlubber like myself. Seashells, waves, the tide, the smells, everything.
We never noticed the sounds of cars driving on the bridge, but we're used to city sounds having lived in the heart of Denver. The restaurant next door never presented an issue either (by the way, delicious!).
Tom and Jean were great with communication and were always available for anything we needed without ever being intrusive. We never actually needed anything because the place was perfect from the get-go.
Katy and I are already planning a return to Seattle when things open up more, and when we do we'd like to stay here again, it's so perfect. Thanks, Tom and Jean!

The sheets were dirty when we arrived and we did have to change them ourselves. (this was on the 4th of July so we werenâ€™t too upset but it was inconvenient) For the price we payed this was quite disappointing especially because at least the cosmetic things could be payed more attention too. The last thing we were disappointed in was the fact that they appeared to be providing coffee and tea but were not stocking it so we were left with the coffee scraps from the last guests. name: Hope

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a repeat Airbnb for us after a long hiatus from travel, and we highly recommend it! It's conveniently located, check in/out is easy, and the apartment is clean and stocked with lots of supplies. It's got all the charming creakiness you'd expect of a 100 year old building (sound does travel, but hopefully we didn't bother the apartment below too much), and a vintage-modern decor vibe that invites you to explore and stay a while. Clawfoot tubs may not be for everyone, but the shower configuration here works pretty well. Loved winding down the chilly evenings cozied up on the couch flipping through the various end table books and old National Geographic back issues. With this apartment as our home base for few days, it was easy to get around on foot, ferry, bus, and ride share (plus light rail in Seattle). Enjoyed dinners at Hound & Bottle and Remedy, both walkable, plus shopping and many other establishments on our list for next time. Encountered lots of nice folks in the area throughout our visit. So glad we were able to come back for a local half marathon and got to stay here again!

The apartment was very stylishly decorated and super comfortable. It is a building with the other units, but I never heard much noise. The view is lovely!

I tried to contact Tory once and never heard back. In his defense, it wasn't an issue with the space, I wanted to try and buy some of the coffee cups he had that were identical to some that my grandmother had. I was surprised to not hear back from him at all, especially after reading reviews about how responsive he was. Even with the minor issues, I'd stay here again. Although not a problem for me, the listing really should mention the number of stairs, as it would be an issue for older folks.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Lots of character and charm in this creaky old apartment! Lots of natural light, plenty of amenities and space whether you want to stay in all day or just have a nice place to rest. It's an easy walk from the ferry terminal (we used the regular WSF ferry, Kitsap Fast Ferry and Foot Ferry to get around). We also walked around downtown and across the bridge to Manette, lots of friendly residents greeting us along the way. This was a great place to rest after a full day in Seattle and other more local adventures. Everything's there if you want to dine in or lounge in front of the TV with cozy blankets to ward off the winter chill. Sounds from neighboring apartments can be heard and it does have stairs up to the building entrance and second floor apartment, all of which was very tolerable for us. Self check-in and check-out was easy, and we messaged Tory only briefly as needed. Definitely a place I'd be happy to stay at again!
